member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RuleExceptions class.

member.summary: Contains the categories that must be applied to an incoming message in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.summary: Indicates the strings that must appear in the body of incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.ContainsHeaderStrings
member.summary: Indicates the strings that must appear in the headers of incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.ContainsRecipientStrings
member.summary: Indicates the strings that must appear in either the ToRecipients or CcRecipients properties of incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.summary: Indicates the strings that must appear in the From property of incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.ContainsSubjectOrBodyStrings
member.summary: Indicates the strings that must appear in either the body or the subject of incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.ContainsSubjectStrings
member.summary: Indicates the strings that must appear in the subject of incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.FlaggedForAction
member.summary: Specifies the flag for action value that must appear on incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.FromAddresses
member.summary: Indicates the e-mail addresses from which incoming messages must be sent in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.FromConnectedAccounts
member.summary: Represents the e-mail account names from which incoming messages have to have been aggregated in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.HasAttachments
member.summary: Indicates whether incoming messages have to have attachments in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.Importance
member.summary: Specifies the importance that is stamped on incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.IsApprovalRequest
member.summary: Indicates whether incoming messages must be approval requests in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.IsAutomaticForward
member.summary: Indicates whether incoming messages must be automatic forwards in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.IsAutomaticReply
member.summary: Indicates whether incoming messages must be automatic replies in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.IsEncrypted
member.summary: Indicates whether incoming messages must be S/MIME encrypted in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.IsMeetingRequest
member.summary: Indicates whether incoming messages must be meeting requests in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.IsMeetingResponse
member.summary: Indicates whether incoming messages must be meeting responses in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.IsNDR
member.summary: Indicates whether incoming messages must be non-delivery reports (NDRs) in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.IsPermissionControlled
member.summary: Indicates whether incoming messages must be permission controlled (RMS protected) in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.IsReadReceipt
member.summary: Indicates whether incoming messages must be read receipts in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.IsSigned
member.summary: Indicates whether incoming messages must be S/MIME signed in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.IsVoiceMail
member.summary: Indicates whether incoming messages must be voice mail messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.ItemClasses
member.summary: Represents the item classes that must be stamped on incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.MessageClassifications
member.summary: Represents the message classifications that must be stamped on incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.NotSentToMe
member.summary: Indicates whether the owner of the mailbox must not be in the ToRecipients property of the incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.SentCcMe
member.summary: Indicates whether the owner of the mailbox has to be in the CcRecipients property of incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.SentOnlyToMe
member.summary: Indicates whether the owner of the mailbox has to be the only one in the ToRecipients property of incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.SentToAddresses
member.summary: Indicates the e-mail addresses that incoming messages have to have been sent to in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.SentToMe
member.summary: Indicates whether the owner of the mailbox has to be in the ToRecipients property of incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.SentToOrCcMe
member.summary: Indicates whether the owner of the mailbox has to be in either a ToRecipients or CcRecipients property of incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.Sensitivity
member.summary: Indicates the sensitivity that must be stamped on incoming messages in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.WithinDateRange
member.summary: Specifies the date range within which incoming messages have to have been received in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Exchange.RuleExceptions.WithinSizeRange
member.summary: Specifies the minimum and maximum sizes that incoming messages must be in order for the condition or exception to apply.

member.summary: Represents the type of free/busy information returned in the response.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.FreeBusyViewType.None
member.summary: This value is not valid for requests. This value is valid for responses.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.FreeBusyViewType.MergedOnly
member.summary: Represents an aggregated free/busy stream. In cross-forest scenarios in which the target user in one forest does not have an Availability service configured, the Availability service of the requestor retrieves the target user's free/busy information from the free/busy public folder. Because public folders only store free/busy information in merged form, MergedOnly is the only available information.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.FreeBusyViewType.FreeBusy
member.summary: Represents the legacy status information: free, busy, tentative, and OOF. This also includes the start/end times of the appointments. This view is richer than the legacy free/busy view because individual meeting start and end times are provided instead of an aggregated free/busy stream.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.FreeBusyViewType.FreeBusyMerged
member.summary: Represents all the properties in FreeBusy with a stream of merged free/busy availability information.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.FreeBusyViewType.Detailed
member.summary: Represents the legacy status information: free, busy, tentative, and OOF; the start/end times of the appointments; and various properties of the appointment such as subject, location, and importance.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.FreeBusyViewType.DetailedMerged
member.summary: Represents all the properties in Detailed with a stream of merged free/busy availability information.

member.name: T:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode
member.summary: Provides status information about the request.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.NoError
member.summary: No error occurred for the request.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorAccessDenied
member.summary: This error occurs when the calling account does not have the rights to perform the requested action.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorAccessModeSpecified
member.summary: This error is for internal use only. This error is not returned.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorAccountDisabled
member.summary: This error occurs when the account in question has been disabled.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorAddDelegatesFailed
member.summary: This error occurs when a list with added delegates cannot be saved.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorAddressSpaceNotFound
member.summary: This error occurs when the address space record, or Domain Name System (DNS) domain name, for cross-forest availability could not be found in the Active Directory database.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorADOperation
member.summary: This error occurs when the operation failed because of communication problems with Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorADSessionFilter
member.summary: This error is returned when a ResolveNames operation request specifies a name that is not valid.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorADUnavailable
member.summary: This error occurs when AD DS is unavailable.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorAutoDiscoverFailed
member.summary: This error indicates that Exchange Web Services tried to determine the location of a cross-forest computer that is running Exchange 2010 that has the Client Access server role installed by using the Autodiscover service, but the call to the Autodiscover service failed.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorAffectedTaskOccurrencesRequired
member.summary: This error indicates that the AffectedTaskOccurrences attribute was not specified. When the DeleteItem element is used to delete at least one item that is a task, and regardless of whether that task is recurring or not, the AffectedTaskOccurrences attribute has to be specified so that DeleteItem can determine whether to delete the current occurrence or the entire series.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorAttachmentNestLevelLimitExceeded
member.summary: Specifies that an attempt was made to create an item with more than 10 nested attachments.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorAttachmentSizeLimitExceeded
member.summary: The CreateAttachment element returns this error if an attempt is made to create an attachment with size exceeding Int32.MaxValue, in bytes. The GetAttachment element returns this error if an attempt to retrieve an existing attachment with size exceeding Int32.MaxValue, in bytes.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorArchiveFolderPathCreation
member.summary: Applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorArchiveMailboxNotEnabled
member.summary: Applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorArchiveMailboxServiceDiscoveryFailed
member.summary: Applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorAvailabilityConfigNotFound
member.summary: This error indicates that the availability configuration information for the local forest is missing from AD DS.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorBatchProcessingStopped
member.summary: This error indicates that an exception occurred while processing an item and that exception is likely to occur for the items that follow. Requests may include multiple items; for example, a GetItem operation request might include multiple identifiers. In general, items are processed one at a time. If an exception occurs while processing an item and that exception is likely to occur for the items that follow, items that follow will not be processed.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarCannotMoveOrCopyOccurrence
member.summary: This error occurs when an attempt is made to move or copy an occurrence of a recurring calendar item.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarCannotUpdateDeletedItem
member.summary: This error occurs when an attempt is made to update a calendar item that is located in the Deleted Items folder and when meeting updates or cancellations are to be sent according to the value of the SendMeetingInvitationsOrCancellations attribute.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarCannotUseIdForOccurrenceId
member.summary: This error occurs when the UpdateItem, GetItem, DeleteItem, MoveItem, CopyItem, or SendItem operation is called and the ID that was specified is not an occurrence ID of any recurring calendar item.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarCannotUseIdForRecurringMasterId
member.summary: This error occurs when the UpdateItem, GetItem, DeleteItem, MoveItem, CopyItem, or SendItem operation is called and the ID that was specified is not an ID of any recurring master item.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarDurationIsTooLong
member.summary: This error occurs during a CreateItem or UpdateItem operation when a calendar item duration is longer than the maximum allowed, which is currently 5 years.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarEndDateIsEarlierThanStartDate
member.summary: This error occurs when a calendar End time is set to the same time or after the Start time.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarFolderIsInvalidForCalendarView
member.summary: This error occurs when the specified folder for a FindItem operation with a CalendarView element is not of calendar folder type.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarInvalidAttributeValue
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarInvalidDayForTimeChangePattern
member.summary: This error occurs during a CreateItem or UpdateItem operation when invalid values of Day, WeekendDay, and Weekday are used to define the time change pattern.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarInvalidDayForWeeklyRecurrence
member.summary: This error occurs during a CreateItem or UpdateItem operation when invalid values of Day, WeekDay, and WeekendDay are used to specify the weekly recurrence.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarInvalidPropertyState
member.summary: This error occurs when the state of a calendar item recurrence binary large object (BLOB) in the Exchange store is invalid.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarInvalidPropertyValue
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarInvalidRecurrence
member.summary: This error occurs when the specified recurrence cannot be created.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarInvalidTimeZone
member.summary: This error occurs when an invalid time zone is encountered.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarIsCancelledForAccept
member.summary: Indicates that a calendar item has been canceled.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarIsCancelledForDecline
member.summary: Indicates that a calendar item has been canceled.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarIsCancelledForRemove
member.summary: Indicates that a calendar item has been canceled.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarIsCancelledForTentative
member.summary: Indicates that a calendar item has been canceled.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarIsDelegatedForAccept
member.summary: This error indicates that the AcceptItem element is invalid for a calendar item or meeting request in a delegated scenario.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarIsDelegatedForDecline
member.summary: This error indicates that the DeclineItem element is invalid for a calendar item or meeting request in a delegated scenario.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarIsDelegatedForRemove
member.summary: This error indicates that the RemoveItem element is invalid for a meeting cancellation in a delegated scenario.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarIsDelegatedForTentative
member.summary: This error indicates that the TentativelyAcceptItem element is invalid for a calendar item or meeting request in a delegated scenario.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarIsNotOrganizer
member.summary: This error indicates that the operation (currently CancelItem) on the calendar item is not valid for an attendee. Only the meeting organizer can cancel the meeting.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarIsOrganizerForAccept
member.summary: This error indicates that AcceptItem is invalid for the organizers calendar item.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarIsOrganizerForDecline
member.summary: This error indicates that DeclineItem is invalid for the organizers calendar item.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarIsOrganizerForRemove
member.summary: This error indicates that RemoveItem is invalid for the organizers calendar item. To remove a meeting from the calendar, the organizer must use CancelItem.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarIsOrganizerForTentative
member.summary: This error indicates that TentativelyAcceptItem is invalid for the organizers calendar item.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarOccurrenceIndexIsOutOfRecurrenceRange
member.summary: This error indicates that the occurrence index does not point to an occurrence within the current recurrence. For example, if your recurrence pattern defines a set of three meeting occurrences and you try to access the fifth occurrence, this response code will result.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarOccurrenceIsDeletedFromRecurrence
member.summary: This error indicates that any operation on a deleted occurrence (addressed via recurring master ID and occurrence index) is invalid.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarOutOfRange
member.summary: This error is reported on Create/Update calendar item or task recurrence properties when the property value is out of range. For example, specifying the fifteenth week of the month will result in this response code.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarMeetingRequestIsOutOfDate
member.summary: This error indicates that a meeting request is out-of-date and cannot be updated.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCalendarViewRangeTooBig
member.summary: This error occurs when Start to End range for the CalendarView element is more than the maximum allowed, currently 2 years.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCallerIsInvalidADAccount
member.summary: Indicates that the requesting account is not a valid account in the directory database.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotArchiveCalendarContactTaskFolderException
member.summary: Items in Calendar, Contacts, or Tasks folders cannot be archived. The ErrorCannotArchiveCalendarContactTaskFolderException field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotArchiveItemsInPublicFolders
member.summary: Items in public folders cannot be archived. The ErrorCannotArchiveItemsInPublicFolders field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotArchiveItemsInArchiveMailbox
member.summary: Items in archive mailboxes cannot be archived. The ErrorCannotArchiveItemsInArchiveMailbox field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotCreateCalendarItemInNonCalendarFolder
member.summary: This error occurs when a calendar item is being created and the SavedItemFolderId attribute refers to a non-calendar folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotCreateContactInNonContactFolder
member.summary: This error occurs when a contact is being created and the SavedItemFolderId attribute refers to a non-contact folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotCreatePostItemInNonMailFolder
member.summary: This error indicates that a post item cannot be created in a folder other than a mail folder, such as Calendar, Contact, Tasks, Notes, and so on.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotCreateTaskInNonTaskFolder
member.summary: This error occurs when a task is being created and the SavedItemFolderId attribute refers to a non-task folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotDeleteObject
member.summary: This error occurs when the item or folder to delete cannot be deleted.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotDisableMandatoryExtension
member.summary: The end users cannot disable mandatory extensions. The ErrorCannotDisableMandatoryExtension field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotGetSourceFolderPath
member.summary: Unable to read the folder path for the source folder while archiving items. The ErrorCannotGetSourceFolderPath field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotGetExternalEcpUrl
member.summary: Cannot get the external Exchange Control Panel URL. This can happen if the external Exchange Control Panel URL isn't configured. The ErrorCannotGetExternalEcpUrl field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotOpenFileAttachment
member.summary: The GetAttachment operation returns this error if it cannot retrieve the body of a file attachment.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotDeleteTaskOccurrence
member.summary: The DeleteItem Operation returns this error when it fails to delete the current occurrence of a recurring task. This can only happen if the AffectedTaskOccurrences attribute has been set to SpecifiedOccurrenceOnly.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotEmptyFolder
member.summary: Indicates that a folder cannot be emptied.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotSetCalendarPermissionOnNonCalendarFolder
member.summary: This error indicates that the caller tried to set calendar permissions on a non-calendar folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotSetNonCalendarPermissionOnCalendarFolder
member.summary: This error indicates that the caller tried to set non-calendar permissions on a calendar folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotSetPermissionUnknownEntries
member.summary: This error indicates that you cannot set unknown permissions in a permissions set.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotSpecifySearchFolderAsSourceFolder
member.summary: Cannot specify search folders as source folders while archiving items. The ErrorCannotSpecifySearchFolderAsSourceFolder field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotUseFolderIdForItemId
member.summary: This error occurs when a request that requires an item identifier is given a folder identifier.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCannotUseItemIdForFolderId
member.summary: This error occurs when a request that requires a folder identifier is given an item identifier.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorChangeKeyRequired
member.summary: This response code has been replaced by ErrorChangeKeyRequiredForWriteOperations.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorChangeKeyRequiredForWriteOperations
member.summary: This error is returned when the change key for an item is missing or stale. For SendItem, UpdateItem, and UpdateFolder operations, the caller must pass in a correct and current change key for the item. Note that this is the case with UpdateItem even when conflict resolution is set to always overwrite.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorClientDisconnected
member.summary: Indicates that the client is disconnected.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorConnectionFailed
member.summary: This error occurs when Exchange Web Services cannot connect to the mailbox.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorContainsFilterWrongType
member.summary: Indicates that the property inspected for a Contains filter is not a string type.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorContentConversionFailed
member.summary: The GetItem operation returns this error when Exchange Web Services is unable to retrieve the MIME content for the item requested. The CreateItem operation returns this error when Exchange Web Services is unable to create the item from the supplied MIME content. Usually this is an indication that the item property is corrupted or truncated.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCorruptData
member.summary: This error occurs when the data is corrupted and cannot be processed.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCreateItemAccessDenied
member.summary: This error occurs when the caller does not have permission to create the item.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCreateManagedFolderPartialCompletion
member.summary: This error occurs when one or more of the managed folders that were specified in the CreateManagedFolder operation request failed to be created. Search for each folder to determine which folders were created and which folders do not exist.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCreateSubfolderAccessDenied
member.summary: This error occurs when the calling account does not have the permissions required to create the subfolder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCrossMailboxMoveCopy
member.summary: This error occurs when an attempt is made to move an item or folder from one mailbox to another. If the source mailbox and destination mailbox are different, you will get this error.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorCrossSiteRequest
member.summary: Indicates that the request is not allowed because the Client Access server that should service the request is in a different site.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorDataSizeLimitExceeded
member.summary: This error can occur in the following scenarios: 1.An attempt is made to access or write a property on an item and the property value is too large. 2.The base64 encoded MIME content length within the request XML exceeds the limit. 3.The size of the body of an existing item body exceeds the limit. 4.The consumer tries to set an HTML or text body whose length (or combined length in the case of append) exceeds the limit.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorDataSourceOperation
member.summary: This error occurs when the underlying data provider fails to complete the operation.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorDelegateAlreadyExists
member.summary: This error occurs in an AddDelegate operation when the specified user already exists in the list of delegates.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorDelegateCannotAddOwner
member.summary: This error occurs in an AddDelegate operation when the specified user to be added is the owner of the mailbox.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorDelegateMissingConfiguration
member.summary: This error occurs in a GetDelegate operation when either there is no delegate information on the local FreeBusy message or no Active Directory public delegate (no public delegate or no "Send On Behalf" entry in AD DS).

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorDelegateNoUser
member.summary: This error occurs in a GetDelegate operation when either there is no delegate information on the local FreeBusy message or no Active Directory public delegate (no public delegate or no "Send On Behalf" entry in AD DS).

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorDelegateValidationFailed
member.summary: This error occurs in the AddDelegate operation when an added delegate user is not valid.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorDeleteDistinguishedFolder
member.summary: This error occurs when an attempt is made to delete a distinguished folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorDeleteItemsFailed
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorDistinguishedUserNotSupported
member.summary: This error indicates that a distinguished user ID is not valid for the operation. DistinguishedUserType should not be present in the request.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorDistributionListMemberNotExist
member.summary: Indicates that a request distribution list member does not exist in the distribution list.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorDuplicateInputFolderNames
member.summary: This error occurs when duplicate folder names are specified within the FolderNames element of the CreateManagedFolder operation request.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorDuplicateUserIdsSpecified
member.summary: This error indicates that a duplicate user ID has been found in a permission set, either Default or Anonymous are set more than once, or there are duplicate SIDs or recipients.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorEmailAddressMismatch
member.summary: This error occurs when a request attempts to create/update the search parameters of a search folder. For example, this can occur when a search folder is created in the mailbox but the search folder is directed to look in another mailbox.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorEventNotFound
member.summary: This error occurs when the event that is associated with a watermark is deleted before the event is returned. When this error is returned, the subscription is also deleted.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorExceededConnectionCount
member.summary: Indicates that there are more concurrent requests against the server than allowed by a user's policy.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorExceededSubscriptionCount
member.summary: Indicates that a user's throttling policy maximum subscription count has been exceeded.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorExceededFindCountLimit
member.summary: Indicates that a search operation call has exceeded the total number of items that can be returned.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorExpiredSubscription
member.summary: This error indicates that there are more concurrent requests against the server than are allowed by a user's policy.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorExtensionNotFound
member.summary: Cannot find the extension with the specified identifier. The ErrorExtensionNotFound field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorFolderCorrupt
member.summary: This error occurs when the folder is corrupted and cannot be saved.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorFolderNotFound
member.summary: This error indicates that the folder ID that was specified does not correspond to a valid folder, or that the delegate does not have permission to access the folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorFolderPropertRequestFailed
member.summary: This error indicates that the requested property could not be retrieved. This does not indicate that the property does not exist, but that the property was corrupted in some way so that the retrieval failed.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorFolderSave
member.summary: This error indicates that the folder could not be created or updated because of an invalid state.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorFolderSaveFailed
member.summary: This error indicates that the folder could not be created or updated because of an invalid state.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorFolderSavePropertyError
member.summary: This error indicates that the folder could not be created or updated because of invalid property values. The response code lists which properties caused the problem.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorFolderExists
member.summary: This error occurs when an attempt is made to create a folder that has the same name as another folder in the same parent. Duplicate folder names are not allowed.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorFreeBusyGenerationFailed
member.summary: This error is returned when free/busy information cannot be retrieved because of an intervening failure.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorGetServerSecurityDescriptorFailed
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorImContactLimitReached
member.summary: The maximum number of contacts to block/add for instant messaging (IM) has been reached. The ErrorImContactLimitReached field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorImGroupDisplayNameAlreadyExists
member.summary: The IM group display name already exists. The ErrorImGroupDisplayNameAlreadyExists field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorImGroupLimitReached
member.summary: The maximum number of distribution group members to send an IM has been reached. The ErrorImGroupLimitReached field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorImpersonateUserDenied
member.summary: The error is returned in the server-to-server authorization case for Exchange Impersonation when the caller does not have the proper rights to impersonate the specific user in question. This error maps to the ms-Exch-EPI-May-Impersonate extended Active Directory right.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorImpersonationDenied
member.summary: This error is returned in the server-to-server authorization for Exchange Impersonation when the caller does not have the proper rights to impersonate through the Client Access server that they are making the request against. This maps to the ms-Exch-EPI-Impersonation extended Active Directory right.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorImpersonationFailed
member.summary: This error indicates that there was an unexpected error when an attempt was made to perform server-to-server authentication. This response code typically indicates either that the service account that is running the Exchange Web Services application pool is configured incorrectly, that Exchange Web Services cannot talk to the directory, or that a trust between forests is not correctly configured.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorIncorrectSchemaVersion
member.summary: This error indicates that the request was valid for the current Exchange Server version but was invalid for the request server version that was specified.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorIncorrectUpdatePropertyCount
member.summary: This error indicates that each change description in the UpdateItem or UpdateFolder elements must list only one property to update.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorIndividualMailboxLimitReached
member.summary: This error occurs when the request contains too many attendees to resolve. By default, the maximum number of attendees to resolve is 100.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInsufficientResources
member.summary: This error occurs when the mailbox server is overloaded. Try your request again later.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInternalServerError
member.summary: This error indicates that Exchange Web Services encountered an error that it could not recover from, and a more specific response code that is associated with the error that occurred does not exist.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInternalServerTransientError
member.summary: This error indicates that an internal server error occurred and that you should try your request again later.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidAccessLevel
member.summary: This error indicates that the level of access that the caller has on the free/busy data is invalid.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidArgument
member.summary: Indicates an error caused by all invalid arguments passed to the GetMessageTrackingReport operation. This error is returned in the following scenarios: The user specified in the sending-as parameter does not exist in the directory; the user specified in the sending-as parameter is not unique in the directory; the sending-as address is empty; the sending-as address is not a valid email address.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidAttachmentId
member.summary: This error is returned by the GetAttachment Operation or the DeleteAttachment Operation when an attachment that corresponds to the specified ID is not found.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidAttachmentSubfilter
member.summary: This error occurs when you try to bind to an existing search folder by using a complex attachment table restriction. Exchange Web Services only supports simple contains filters against the attachment table. If you try to bind to an existing search folder that has a more complex attachment table restriction (a subfilter), Exchange Web Services cannot render the XML for that filter and returns this response code. Note that you can still call the GetFolder operation on the folder, but do not request the SearchParameters property.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidAttachmentSubfilterTextFilter
member.summary: This error occurs when you try to bind to an existing search folder by using a complex attachment table restriction. Exchange Web Services only supports simple contains filters against the attachment table. If you try to bind to an existing search folder that has a more complex attachment table restriction, Exchange Web Services cannot render the XML for that filter. In this case, the attachment subfilter contains a text filter, but it is not looking at the attachment display name. Note that you can still call the GetFolder operation on the folder, but do not request the SearchParameters property.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidAuthorizationContext
member.summary: This error indicates that the authorization procedure for the requestor failed.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidChangeKey
member.summary: This error occurs when a consumer passes in a folder or item identifier with a change key that cannot be parsed. For example, this could be invalid base64 content or an empty string.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidClientSecurityContext
member.summary: This error indicates that there was an internal error when an attempt was made to resolve the identity of the caller.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidCompleteDate
member.summary: This error is returned when an attempt is made to set the CompleteDate element value of a task to a time in the future. When it is converted to the local time of the Client Access server, the CompleteDate of a task cannot be set to a value that is later than the local time on the Client Access server.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidContactEmailAddress
member.summary: Indicates that an invalid e-mail address was provided for a contact.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidContactEmailIndex
member.summary: Indicates that an invalid e-mail index value was provided for an e-mail entry.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidCrossForestCredentials
member.summary: This error occurs when the credentials that are used to proxy a request to a different directory service forest fail authentication.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidDelegatePermission
member.summary: This error indicates that the specified folder permissions are invalid.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidDelegateUserId
member.summary: This error indicates that the specified delegate user ID is invalid.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidExcludesRestriction
member.summary: This error occurs when the bitmask that was passed into an Excludes element restriction is unable to be parsed.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidExpressionTypeForSubFilter
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidExtendedProperty
member.summary: This error occurs when the following events take place: The caller tries to use an extended property that is not supported by Exchange Web Services. The caller passes in an invalid combination of attribute values for an extended property. This also occurs if no attributes are passed. Only certain combinations are allowed.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidExtendedPropertyValue
member.summary: This error occurs when the value section of an extended property does not match the type of the property; for example, setting an extended property that has PropertyType="String" to an array of integers will result in this error. Any string representation that is not coercible into the type that is specified for the extended property will give this error.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidFolderId
member.summary: This error occurs when the folder ID is corrupt.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidFolderTypeForOperation
member.summary: This error indicates that the specified folder type is invalid for the current operation. For example, you cannot create a Search folder in a public folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidFractionalPagingParameters
member.summary: This error occurs in fractional paging when the user has specified one of the following: A numerator that is greater than the denominator A numerator that is less than zero A denominator that is less than or equal to zero

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidFreeBusyViewType
member.summary: This error occurs when the GetUserAvailability Operation is called with a FreeBusyViewType of None.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidId
member.summary: This error indicates that the ID and/or change key is malformed.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidIdEmpty
member.summary: This error occurs when the caller specifies an Id attribute that is empty.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidIdMalformed
member.summary: This error occurs when the caller specifies an Id attribute that is malformed.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidIdMalformedEwsLegacyIdFormat
member.summary: This error indicates that a folder or item ID that is using the Exchange 2007 format was specified for a request with a version of Exchange 2007 SP1 or later. You cannot use Exchange 2007 IDs in Exchange 2007 SP1 or later requests. You have to use the ConvertId Operation to convert them first.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidIdMonikerTooLong
member.summary: This error occurs when the caller specifies an Id attribute that is too long.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidIdNotAnItemAttachmentId
member.summary: This error is returned whenever an ID that is not an item attachment ID is passed to a Web service method that expects an attachment ID.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidIdReturnedByResolveNames
member.summary: This error occurs when a contact in your mailbox is corrupt.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidIdStoreObjectIdTooLong
member.summary: This error occurs when the caller specifies an Id attribute that is too long.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidIdTooManyAttachmentLevels
member.summary: This error is returned when the attachment hierarchy on an item exceeds the maximum of 255 levels deep.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidIdXml
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidIndexedPagingParameters
member.summary: This error occurs if the offset for indexed paging is negative.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidInternetHeaderChildNodes
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidItemForOperationArchiveItem
member.summary: Invalid item type for an ArchiveItem action. The ErrorInvalidItemForOperationArchiveItem field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidItemForOperationCreateItemAttachment
member.summary: This error is returned when an attempt is made to create an item attachment of an unsupported type. Supported item types for item attachments include the following objects: ItemType MessageType CalendarItemType TaskType ContactItemType For example, if you try to create a MeetingMessage attachment, you will encounter this response code.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidItemForOperationCreateItem
member.summary: This error is returned from a CreateItem Operation if the request contains an unsupported item type. Supported items include the following objects: ItemType MessageType CalendarItemType TaskType ContactItemType Certain types are created as a side effect of doing something else. MeetingMessages, for example, are created when you send a calendar item to attendees; they are not explicitly created.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidItemForOperationAcceptItem
member.summary: This error occurs when an attempt is made to use an AcceptItem operation for an item type other than a meeting request or a calendar item, or when an attempt is made to accept a calendar item occurrence that is in the Deleted Items folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidItemForOperationDeclineItem
member.summary: This error occurs when an attempt is made to use a DeclineItem operation for an item type other than a meeting request or a calendar item, or when an attempt is made to decline a calendar item occurrence that is in the Deleted Items folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidItemForOperationCancelItem
member.summary: This error occurs when an attempt is made to use a CancelItem operation on an item type other than a calendar item.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidItemForOperationExpandDL
member.summary: This error indicates that the ExpandDL Operation is valid only for private distribution lists.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidItemForOperationRemoveItem
member.summary: This error is returned from a RemoveItem operation if the request specifies an item that is not a meeting cancellation item.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidItemForOperationSendItem
member.summary: This error is returned from a SendItem Operation if the request specifies an item that is not a message item.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidItemForOperationTentative
member.summary: This error occurs when an attempt is made to use TentativelyAcceptItem for an item type other than a meeting request or a calendar item, or when an attempt is made to tentatively accept a calendar item occurrence that is in the Deleted Items folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidLogonType
member.summary: Indicates that an invalid logon type was used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidMailbox
member.summary: Indicates that the CreateItem or UpdateItem operation failed while creating or updating a personal distribution list.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidManagedFolderProperty
member.summary: This error occurs when the structure of the managed folder is corrupted and cannot be rendered.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidManagedFolderQuota
member.summary: This error occurs when the quota that is set on the managed folder is less than zero, which indicates a corrupted managed folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidManagedFolderSize
member.summary: This error occurs when the size that is set on the managed folder is less than zero, which indicates a corrupted managed folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidMergedFreeBusyInterval
member.summary: This error occurs when the supplied merged free/busy internal value is invalid. The default minimum value is 5 minutes. The default maximum value is 1440 minutes.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidNameForNameResolution
member.summary: This error occurs when the name is invalid for the ResolveNames Operation. For example, a zero length string, a single space, a comma, and a dash are all invalid names.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidOperation
member.summary: This is a general error that is used when the requested operation is invalid. For example, you cannot do the following: Perform a Deep traversal by using the FindFolder Operation on a public folder. Move or copy the public folder root. Delete an associated item by using any mode except Hard delete. Move or copy an associated item.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidNetworkServiceContext
member.summary: This error indicates an error in the Network Service account on the Client Access server.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidOofParameter
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidPagingMaxRows
member.summary: This error occurs when a consumer passes in a zero or a negative value for the maximum rows to be returned.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidParentFolder
member.summary: This error occurs when a consumer passes in an invalid parent folder for an operation. For example, this error is returned if you try to create a folder within a search folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidPercentCompleteValue
member.summary: This error is returned when an attempt is made to set a task completion percentage to an invalid value. The value must be between 0 and 100 (inclusive).

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidPermissionSettings
member.summary: This error indicates that the permission level is inconsistent with the permission settings.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidPhoneCallId
member.summary: Indicates that the caller identifier is not valid.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidPhoneNumber
member.summary: Indicates that the phone number is not correct or does not fit the dial plan rules.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidUserInfo
member.summary: This error indicates that an internally inconsistent UserId was specified for a permissions operation. For example, if a distinguished user ID is specified (Default or Anonymous), this error is returned if you also try to specify a SID, or primary SMTP address or display name for this user.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidPropertyAppend
member.summary: This error occurs when the property that you are trying to append to does not support appending. The following are the only properties that support appending: Recipient collections (ToRecipients, CcRecipients, BccRecipients) Attendee collections (RequiredAttendees, OptionalAttendees, Resources) Body ReplyTo In addition, this error occurs when a message body is appended if the format specified in the request does not match the format of the item in the store.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidPropertyDelete
member.summary: This error occurs if the delete operation is specified in an UpdateItem Operation or UpdateFolder Operation call for a property that does not support the delete operation. For example, you cannot delete the ItemId property of the ItemType object.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidPropertyForExists
member.summary: This error occurs if the consumer passes in one of the flag properties in an Exists filter. For example, this error occurs if the IsRead or IsFromMe flags are specified in the Exists element. The request should use the IsEqualTo element instead for these as they are flags and therefore part of a single property.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidPropertyForOperation
member.summary: This error occurs when the property that you are trying to manipulate does not support the operation that is being performed on it.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidPropertyRequest
member.summary: This error occurs if a property that is specified in the request is not available for the item type. For example, this error is returned if a property that is only available on calendar items is requested in a GetItem Operation call for a message or is updated in an UpdateItem Operation call for a message. This occurs in the following operations: GetItem Operation GetFolder Operation UpdateItem Operation UpdateFolder Operation

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidPropertySet
member.summary: This error indicates that the property that you are trying to manipulate does not support the operation that is being performed on it. For example, this error is returned if the property that you are trying to set is read-only.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidPropertyUpdateSentMessage
member.summary: This error occurs during an UpdateItem Operation when a client tries to update certain properties of a message that has already been sent. For example, the following properties cannot be updated on a sent message: IsReadReceiptRequested IsDeliveryReceiptRequested

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidProxySecurityContext
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidPullSubscriptionId
member.summary: This error occurs if you call the GetEvents Operation or the Unsubscribe Operation by using a push subscription ID. To unsubscribe from a push subscription, you must respond to a push request with an unsubscribe response, or disconnect your Web service and wait for the push notifications to time out.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidPushSubscriptionUrl
member.summary: This error is returned by the Subscribe Operation when it creates a push subscription and indicates that the URL that is included in the request is invalid. The following conditions must be met for Exchange Web Services to accept the URL: String length > 0 and < 2083. Protocol is http or https. The URL can be parsed by the URI Microsoft .NET Framework class.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidRecipients
member.summary: This error indicates that the recipient collection on your message or the attendee collection on your calendar item is invalid. For example, this error will be returned when an attempt is made to send an item that has no recipients.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidRecipientSubfilter
member.summary: This error indicates that the search folder has a recipient table filter that Exchange Web Services cannot represent. To get around this error, retrieve the folder without requesting the search parameters.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidRecipientSubfilterComparison
member.summary: This error indicates that the search folder has a recipient table filter that Exchange Web Services cannot represent. To get around this error, retrieve the folder without requesting the search parameters.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidRecipientSubfilterOrder
member.summary: This error indicates that the search folder has a recipient table filter that Exchange Web Services cannot represent. To get around this error, retrieve the folder without requesting the search parameters.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidRecipientSubfilterTextFilter
member.summary: This error indicates that the search folder has a recipient table filter that Exchange Web Services cannot represent. To get around this error, retrieve the folder without requesting the search parameters.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidReferenceItem
member.summary: This error is returned from the CreateItem Operation for Forward and Reply response objects in the following scenarios: The referenced item identifier is not a Message, a CalendarItem, or a descendant of a Message or CalendarItem. The reference item identifier is for a CalendarItem and the organizer is trying to Reply or ReplyAll to himself. The message is a draft and Reply or ReplyAll is selected. The reference item, for SuppressReadReceipt, is not a Message or a descendant of a Message.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidRequest
member.summary: This error occurs when the SOAP request has a SOAP action header, but nothing in the SOAP body. Note that the SOAP Action header is not required as Exchange Web Services can determine the method to call from the local name of the root element in the SOAP body.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidRestriction
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidRetentionTagTypeMismatch
member.summary: A policy tag of the wrong type was applied to an item or folder. The ErrorInvalidRetentionTagTypeMismatch field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidRetentionTagInvisible
member.summary: An invisible retention policy was applied to the item or folder. The ErrorInvalidRetentionTagInvisible field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidRetentionTagInheritance
member.summary: An implicit policy tag was applied to the target item or folder. The ErrorInvalidRetentionTagInheritance field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidRetentionTagIdGuid
member.summary: Invalid retention tag identifier GUID. The ErrorInvalidRetentionTagIdGuid field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidRoutingType
member.summary: This error occurs if the routing type that is passed for an EmailAddressType is invalid. Typically, the routing type is set to Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP).

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidScheduledOofDuration
member.summary: This error occurs if the specified duration end time is not greater than the start time, or if the end time does not occur in the future.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidSecurityDescriptor
member.summary: This error indicates that the Exchange security descriptor on the Calendar folder in the store is corrupted.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidSendItemSaveSettings
member.summary: This error occurs during an attempt to send an item where the SavedItemFolderId is specified in the request but the SaveItemToFolder property is set to false.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidSerializedAccessToken
member.summary: This error indicates that the token that was passed in the header is malformed, does not refer to a valid account in the directory, or is missing the primary group ConnectingSID.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidServerVersion
member.summary: This error indicates that an invalid request server version was specified in the request.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidSid
member.summary: This error occurs when an invalid SID is passed in a request.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidSIPUri
member.summary: Indicates that the SIP name, dial plan, or the phone number are invalid SIP URI.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidSmtpAddress
member.summary: This error occurs when the SMTP address cannot be parsed.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidSubfilterType
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidSubfilterTypeNotAttendeeType
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidSubfilterTypeNotRecipientType
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidSubscription
member.summary: This error indicates that the subscription is no longer valid. This could be because the Client Access server is restarting or because the subscription is expired.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidSubscriptionRequest
member.summary: This error indicates that the subscribe request included multiple public folder IDs. A subscription can include multiple folders from the same mailbox or one public folder ID.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidSyncStateData
member.summary: This error is returned by SyncFolderItems or SyncFolderHierarchy if the SyncState data that is passed is invalid. To fix this error, you must resynchronize without the sync state. Make sure that if you are persisting sync state BLOBs, you are not accidentally truncating the BLOB.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidTimeInterval
member.summary: This error indicates that the specified time interval is invalid. The start time must be greater than or equal to the end time.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidUserOofSettings
member.summary: This error indicates that the user Out of Office (OOF) settings are invalid because of a missing internal or external reply.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidUserPrincipalName
member.summary: This error occurs during Exchange Impersonation. The caller passed in an invalid UPN in the SOAP header that was not accessible in the directory.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidUserSid
member.summary: This error occurs when an invalid SID is passed in a request.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidUserSidMissingUPN
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidValueForProperty
member.summary: This error indicates that the comparison value in the restriction is invalid for the property you are comparing against. For example, the comparison value of DateTimeCreated > true would return this response code. This response code is also returned if you specify an enumeration property in the comparison, but the value that you are comparing against is not a valid value for that enumeration.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorInvalidWatermark
member.summary: This error is caused by an invalid watermark.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorIPGatewayNotFound
member.summary: Indicates that a valid VoIP gateway is not available.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorIrresolvableConflict
member.summary: This error indicates that conflict resolution was unable to resolve changes for the properties. The items in the store may have been changed and have to be updated. Retrieve the updated change key and try again.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorItemCorrupt
member.summary: This error indicates that the state of the object is corrupted and cannot be retrieved. When you are retrieving an item, only certain properties will be in this state, such as Body and MimeContent. Omit these properties and retry the operation.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorItemNotFound
member.summary: This error occurs when the item was not found or you do not have permission to access the item.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorItemPropertyRequestFailed
member.summary: This error occurs if a property request on an item fails. The property may exist, but it could not be retrieved.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorItemSave
member.summary: This error occurs when attempts to save the item or folder fail.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorItemSavePropertyError
member.summary: This error occurs when attempts to save the item or folder fail because of invalid property values. The response code includes the path of the invalid properties.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorLegacyMailboxFreeBusyViewTypeNotMerged
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorLocalServerObjectNotFound
member.summary: This response code is not used.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorLogonAsNetworkServiceFailed
member.summary: This error indicates that the Availability service was unable to log on as the network service to proxy requests to the appropriate sites or forests. This response typically indicates a configuration error.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMailboxConfiguration
member.summary: This error indicates that the mailbox information in AD DS is configured incorrectly.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMailboxDataArrayEmpty
member.summary: This error indicates that the MailboxDataArray property in the request is empty. You must supply at least one mailbox identifier.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMailboxDataArrayTooBig
member.summary: This error occurs when more than 100 entries are supplied in a MailboxDataArray.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMailboxHoldNotFound
member.summary: The referenced mailbox hold is not found. The ErrorMailboxHoldNotFound field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMailboxLogonFailed
member.summary: This error occurs when the connection to the mailbox to get the calendar view information failed.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMailboxMoveInProgress
member.summary: This error indicates that the mailbox is being moved to a different mailbox store or server. This error can also indicate that the mailbox is on another server or mailbox database.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMailboxStoreUnavailable
member.summary: This error indicates that one of the following error conditions occurred: The mailbox store is corrupt. The mailbox store is being stopped. The mailbox store is offline. A network error occurred when an attempt was made to access the mailbox store. The mailbox store is overloaded and cannot accept any more connections. The mailbox store has been paused.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMailRecipientNotFound
member.summary: This error occurs if the MailboxData information cannot be mapped to a valid mailbox account.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMailTipsDisabled
member.summary: Indicates that mail tips are disabled.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorManagedFolderAlreadyExists
member.summary: This error occurs if the managed folder that you are trying to create already exists in a mailbox.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorManagedFolderNotFound
member.summary: This error occurs when the folder name that was specified in the request does not map to a managed folder definition in AD DS. You can only create instances of managed folders for folders that are defined in AD DS. Check the name and try again.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorManagedFoldersRootFailure
member.summary: This error indicates that the managed folders root was deleted from the mailbox or that a folder exists in the same parent folder that has the name of the managed folder root. This will also occur if the attempt to create the root managed folder fails.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMeetingSuggestionGenerationFailed
member.summary: This error indicates that the suggestions engine encountered a problem when it was trying to generate the suggestions.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMessageDispositionRequired
member.summary: This error occurs if the MessageDisposition attribute is not set. This attribute is required for the following: The CreateItem Operation and the UpdateItem Operation when the item being created or updated is a Message. CancelCalendarItem, AcceptItem, DeclineItem, or TentativelyAcceptItem response objects.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMessageSizeExceeded
member.summary: This error indicates that the message that you are trying to send exceeds the allowed limits.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMimeContentConversionFailed
member.summary: This error occurs when the MIME content is not a valid iCal for a CreateItem Operation. For a GetItem Operation, this response indicates that the MIME content could not be generated.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMimeContentInvalid
member.summary: This error occurs when the MIME content is invalid.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMimeContentInvalidBase64String
member.summary: This error occurs when the MIME content in the request is not a valid base 64 string.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMissingArgument
member.summary: This error indicates that a required argument was missing from the request. The response message text indicates which argument to check.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMissingEmailAddress
member.summary: This error indicates that you specified a distinguished folder ID in the request, but the account that made the request does not have a mailbox on the system. In that case, you must supply a Mailbox sub-element under DistinguishedFolderId.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMissingEmailAddressForManagedFolder
member.summary: This error indicates that you specified a distinguished folder ID in the request, but the account that made the request does not have a mailbox on the system. In that case, you must supply a Mailbox sub-element under DistinguishedFolderId. This response is returned from the CreateManagedFolder Operation.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMissingInformationEmailAddress
member.summary: This error occurs if the EmailAddress element is missing.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMissingInformationReferenceItemId
member.summary: This error occurs if the ReferenceItemId is missing.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMissingItemForCreateItemAttachment
member.summary: This error is returned when an attempt is made to not include the item element in the ItemAttachment element of a CreateAttachment Operation request.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMissingManagedFolderId
member.summary: This error occurs when the policy IDs property, property tag 0x6732, for the folder is missing. You should consider this a corrupted folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMissingRecipients
member.summary: This error indicates that you tried to send an item without including recipients. Note that if you call the CreateItem Operation with a message disposition that causes the message to be sent, you will get the following response code: ErrorInvalidRecipients.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMissingUserIdInformation
member.summary: This error indicates that a UserId has not been fully specified in a permissions set.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMoreThanOneAccessModeSpecified
member.summary: This error indicates that you have specified more than one ExchangeImpersonation property value within a request.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMoveCopyFailed
member.summary: This error indicates that the move or copy operation failed. Moving occurs in the CreateItem Operation when you accept a meeting request that is in the Deleted Items folder. In addition, if you decline a meeting request, cancel a calendar item, or remove a meeting from your calendar, it is moved to the Deleted Items folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMoveDistinguishedFolder
member.summary: This error occurs if you try to move a distinguished folder.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorMultiLegacyMailboxAccess
member.summary: A request attempted to access multiple mailbox servers. The ErrorMultiLegacyMailboxAccess field is applicable for clients that target Exchange Online and versions of Exchange starting with Exchange Server 2013.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorNameResolutionMultipleResults
member.summary: This error occurs if the ResolveNames Operation returns more than one result or the ambiguous name that you specified matches more than one object in the directory. The response code includes the matched names in the response data.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorNameResolutionNoMailbox
member.summary: This error indicates that the caller does not have a mailbox on the system. The ResolveNames Operation or ExpandDL Operation is invalid for connecting a user without a mailbox.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorNameResolutionNoResults
member.summary: This error indicates that the ResolveNames Operation returns no results.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorNoCalendar
member.summary: This error occurs if there is no Calendar folder for the mailbox.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorNoDestinationCASDueToKerberosRequirements
member.summary: This error indicates that the request referred to a mailbox in another Active Directory site, but no Client Access servers in the destination site were configured for Windows Authentication, and therefore the request could not be proxied.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorNoDestinationCASDueToSSLRequirements
member.summary: This error indicates that the request referred to a mailbox in another Active Directory site, but no Client Access servers in the destination site were configured for SSL connections, and therefore the request could not be proxied.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Exchange.ResponseCode.ErrorNoDestinationCASDueToVersionMismatch
